snippet: India, the world’s third-largest carbon polluter, was the last major country to issue its plan before a major summit meeting in Paris in December.
abstract: India announces long-term plan to reduce greenhouse gas emissions while developing sustainable energy sources; world's third-largest polluter, who has resisted curbing fossil-fuel use out of fear of impacting country's economic development, announces plan ahead of December Paris climate summit; experts praise plan yet warn collective global efforts still fall short of meaningful targets.

byline.original: By ELLEN BARRY and CORAL DAVENPORT
byline.contributor: Ellen Barry reported from New Delhi, and Coral Davenport from Washington.

lead_paragraph: India, the world’s third-largest carbon polluter, was the last major country to issue its plan before a major summit meeting in Paris in December.

headline.main: India Announces Plan to Lower Rate of Greenhouse Gas Emissions
headline.print_headline: India Announces Plan to Lower Rate of Greenhouse Gas Emissions
